Description.val:
The AN/SLQ-32(V) provides a family of modular ship born electronic warfare equipment which is installed on all surface combatants, aircraft carriers, amphibious ships and auxiliaries in the surface Navy.   The system provides early detection, analysis, threat warning and protection from anti-ship missiles.  The OPN 2312 budget supports the AN/SLQ-32(V)6 and AN/SLQ-32(V)7 variants through procurement and installation.  The SEWIP Block 1B3 and Block 2 units are installed conjunctively and comprise the AN/SLQ-32(V)6 system.  The SEWIP Block 1B3, Block 2 and Block 3 units are installed conjunctively and comprise the AN/SLQ-32(V)7 system.

TC056:  SURFACE ELECTRONIC WARFARE (EW) IMPROVEMENTS BLOCK 1
The Surface Electronic Warfare (EW) Improvement Program (SEWIP) will develop a modern, highly capable family of EW systems by block upgrade of the current AN/SLQ-32 system that is robust in detecting and countering current and future threats and will extend the service life of AN/SLQ3-2(V) systems.  Funding procures upgrades to the current AN/SLQ-32 system.

BLOCK 1B1 - SMALL SHIP ELECTRONIC MEASURES SYSTEM (SSESM):  
Small Ship Electronic Support Measures System (SSESM) provides Specific Emitter Identification (SEI) capability to various ships/ship classes in a stand-alone configuration.  

BLOCK 1B2 - FEDERATED SPECIFIC EMITTER IDENTIFICATION (SEI):  
The federated SEI, consisting of SEI hardware plus an ICAD modification kit, fully integrates SEI functionality with the ICAD/Q-70 console. 

BLOCK 1B3 - HIGH GAIN HIGH SENSITIVITY (HGHS): 
High Gain High Sensitivity (HGHS) Adjunct Sensor is a critical improvement for threat correlation, situational awareness, and extending the battle space. Engineering Change Proposal (ECP) funding is to support changes resulting from software and hardware trouble reports from production, shipboard installations and/or land based testing. Tech Refresh funding is provided to address obsolescence and reliability issues affecting fielded systems. The SEWIP Block 1B3 and Block 2 units are installed conjunctively to compose the AN/SLQ-32(V)6 system. The SEWIP Block 1B3, Block 2 and Block 3 units are installed conjunctively to compose the AN/SLQ-32(V)7 system. The SEWIP Block 1B3 P-3a funding has been broken out to separately show systems installed with SEWIP Block 2 (FMP Block 1B3 for SLQ-32 (V)6) and systems installed with SEWIP Block 2 and Block 3 (FMP Block 1B3 for SLQ-32 (V)7). For FMP Block 1B3 systems for SLQ-32 (V)7, production lead times for Block 1B3 are 15 months and these systems are then delivered to the Block 3 Integration Facility, NSWC Crane, 6 months (180 days) prior to delivery as part of an integrated SLQ-32 (V)7 system. The 180 days is required for integration and testing with SEWIP Block 3 at the NSCW Crane Integration Facility.

TC059:  SURFACE ELECTRONIC WARFARE (EW) IMPROVEMENTS BLOCK 2
Block 2 will provide AN/SLQ-32(V) an upgraded antenna, receiver, and combat systems interface. The upgrades will pace the threat, improve detection and accuracy and mitigate Electromagnetic Interference (EMI). The Block 2 hardware cost includes the SEWIP Block 2 ES system, Blanker-Video Mixer Group (AN/SLA-10D), Common Processing System, Common Display System, Liquid Conditioning Unit and Data Adaptation Processor. The SEWIP Block 1B3 and Block 2 units are installed conjunctively and compose the AN/SLQ-32(V)6 system. The SEWIP Block 1B3, Block 2 and Block 3 units are installed conjunctively to compose the AN/SLQ-32(V)7 system. The SEWIP Block 2 P-3a funding has been broken out to separately show systems installed with SEWIP Block 1B3 (FMP Block 2 for SLQ-32 (V)6 and systems installed with SEWIP Block 1B3 and Block 3 (FMP Block 2 for SLQ-32 (V)7). For FMP Block 2 systems for SLQ-32 (V)7, production lead times for Block 2 are 17 months and these systems are then delivered to the system integrator, NSWC Crane, 6 months (180 days) prior to delivery as part of an integrated SLQ-32 (V)7 system. The 180 days is required for integration and testing with SEWIP Block 3 at the NSWC Crane Integration Facility.

TC060:  SURFACE ELECTRONIC WARFARE (EW) IMPROVEMENTS BLOCK 3:
Block 3 will provide an Electronic Attack (EA) capability improvement required for the AN/SLQ-32(V) system to keep pace with the threat. SEWIP Block 3 will provide a common EA capability to surface combatants (CVN, DDG, LHD) outfitted with the active variant of the AN/SLQ-32, mainly the (V)3 and (V)4, as well as select new-construction platforms. The program builds on the EW Electronic Support (ES) capability delivered by Blocks 1 and 2.  Development Status/Major Milestones are: Long Lead Material (LLM) was procured Q4 FY17, Milestone C Low Rate Initial Production (LRIP) Q1 FY19, IOT&E Q4 FY22, FRP is Q3 FY23. The SEWIP Block 1B3, Block 2 and Block 3 units compose the AN/SLQ-32(V)7 system.  This may be accomplished as a conjunctive installation with all SEWIP components installed at the same time or as a non-conjunctive installation by installing the SEWIP Block 3 on a ship with SEWIP Block 1B3 and 2 previously installed.

Block 3T (AN/SLQ-59) will provide an Electronic Attack (EA) capability improvement required for the AN/SLQ32(V) system to keep pace with the threat.  Block 3T provides initial, limited interim capability of a focused application of the Naval Research Lab (NRL) Transportable EW Module (TEWM) system to meet an urgent operational needs (UON) statement.

TC5IN:  FMP INSTALLATIONS
Shipboard installation of AN/SLQ-32(V) ECP/Field Changes and the Surface EW Improvements Blocks 1, 2 and 3.

TC6IN:  NON-FMP INSTALLATIONS
Installation of AN/SLQ-32(V) ECP/Field Changes and the Surface EW Improvements Blocks 1, 2 and 3 at Shore Site Facilities.

[P40A / TC956 - USCG WMSL AN/SLQ-32 B(V)2]: TC956 - UNITED STATES COAST GUARD (USCG) WMSL AN/SLQ-32B(V)2
This supports USCG Maritime Security Cutter, Large (WMSL) 758 and 759 with AN/SLQ-32B(V)2 systems and is in accordance with the requirements of OPNAVINST 4000.79A for Navy Type - Navy Owned (NTNO) material.  NTNO material is procured by the Navy and installed by the USCG.

[P40A / TC959 - SEWIP LITE FOR USCG SHIPS]: TC959 - SEWIP LITE FOR UNITED STATES COAST GUARD (USCG) SHIPS: 
This details the requirements for SEWIP Block 1B2 and SEWIP Lite systems in support of USCG ships, including Offshore Patrol Cutter(OPC), WMSL and Heavy Polar Ice Breaker (HPIB). OPNAVINST 4000.79A for Navy Type - Navy Owned (NTNO) material applies.  USN is responsible for equipment procurement & USCG is responsible for the install.  

SEWIP Lite is a variant of the SEWIP Block 2 specifically tailored for the needs of small ships, such as Littoral Combat Shop (LCS), OPC, WMSL and HPIB to address fleet emergent needs for a robust, capable, and sustainable EW system that meets the space, weight and power limitations of these smaller ships.

[P40A / SEWIP LITE SHORE]: Note:
This line supports SEWIP Lite systems provide as Navy Type - Navy Owned to the USCG in accordance with OPNAVINST 4000.79A for NTNO material.

[P40A / SEWIP BLOCK 1B2 LITE SHORE INSTALL]: Note:
Shore Site Installs will be funded through the SEWIP Program.

[P40A / TC961 - SOLID STATE PRODUCT SUPPORT INTEGRATOR (PSI)]: TC961 - SOLID STATE PRODUCT SUPPORT INTEGRATOR (PSI)
The Solid State Product Support Integrator (PSI) for Radio Frequency (RF) funding line supports the stand-up of this capability for select components of SEWIP Block 3. The Solid State PSI will provide engineering analysis and product support strategies as well as test and repair capabilities for the high band (HB) and low band (LB) transmit (Tx) and receive (Rx) components of SEWIP Block 3.  Solid State PSI funding supports the procurements (investment expense) of HB and LB Tx and Rx module test and repair equipment in FY20-24.  The Solid State PSI capability is shared with AMDR. 

Note:

(1) TC961 Solid State PSI Procurements provide the following, Test Fixture and Test Set (FY21), Repair Equipment (FY22), and Calibration Equipment (FY23).

[P40A / TC960 - AN/SLQ-32 (V) TRAINING SYSTEMS]: TC960 - AN/SLQ-32 (V) TRAINING SYSTEMS
This TC supports the procurement and installation of training systems in support of the AN/SLQ-32(V)6 and (V)7 systems including the Multipurpose Reconfigurable Training System (MRTS) and Electronic Warfare Tactical Simulator (TACSIM).  MRTS provides support for Fleet maintenance training for SEWIP Block 2 and SEWIP Block 3.  MRTS simulates the tactical system's components and subcomponents necessary for training without requiring the procurement of a full SEWIP Block 1B3, Block 2, or Block 3 system.  The TACSIM training system provides tactically-representative SEWIP operator training to EW operators, including simulation capabilities for SLQ-32(V)6, SLQ-32(V)7, SKCS, combat system simulation of SSDS and AEGIS, and system integration with the onboard Surface Electronic Warfare Team Trainer (SWWTT).

Justification.val: The FY 2020 enacted amount includes congressional rescissions of $4.548 million to FY 2018 funding and $13.470 million to FY 2019 funding. However, these rescissions are not reflected on the P-40.

Name.val: 2) TC959 - SEWIP LITE FOR USCG SHIPS

FiscalYear.@footnote: TC959 - SEWIP LITE FOR USCG: This details the requirements for SEWIP Block 1B2 and SEWIP Lite systems in support of USCG OPC, WMSL and HPIB ships. OPNAVINST 4000.79A for Navy Type - Navy Owned (NTNO) material applies. SEWIP Lite is a variant of the SEWIP Block 2 specifically tailored for the needs of small ships, such as LCS, OPC, WMSL and HPIB to address fleet emergent needs for a robust, capable, and sustainable EW system that meets the space, weight and power limitations of these smaller ships

Name.@footnote: At the FY 2020 President's Budget request, TC959 contained 2.6 and 2.7 for SEWIP Block 1B2 and Lite procurements for WMSL back fit as well as associated installation funding in 2.8 and 2.9.  Under the NTNO agreement, the USN will be responsible for funding the procurement of these systems and the USCG will be responsible for the back fit installation cost.  The FY 2021 President's Budget request 2.1 SEWIP Block 1B2 and 2.2 SEWIP Lite contain all back fit and forward fit quantity requirements.  Installation costs for SEWIP Block 1B2 and Lite back fit have been removed from the FY 2021 President's Budget request.

Description.val:
The federated SEI, consisting of SEI hardware plus an ICAD modification kit, fully integrates SEI functionality with the ICAD/Q-70 console.  Tech Refresh funding is provided to address obsolescence and reliability issues affecting fielded systems.  

Notes:  

(1)  For FMP Block 1B2 systems, the production lead time is 20 months, 14 months for production and 6 months for systems integration prior to delivery to a ship for installation.  The system integrator, NSWC Crane, conducts integration, testing, and preparation for shipment.  The 6 month integration period is composed of 135 days for integration and testing of the SEWIP Blocks 1B2, 1B3 and 2 into an SLQ-32(V)6 system, preparation for shipment (15 days) and delivery to the shipyard 30 days prior to the start of the availability (A-30). 

(2)  SEWIP Block 1B2 unit cost decrease since the FY 2020 President's Budget request for FY20-FY25 is the result of the qualification of new tuner, which lowered the unit cost.  This change was incorporated into the FY20 production cost.

Description.val:
Block 1B3: High Gain High Sensitivity (HGHS) 
High Gain High Sensitivity (HGHS) Adjunct Sensor is a critical improvement for threat correlation, situational awareness, and extending the battle space. Engineering Change Proposal (ECP) funding is provided to support changes resulting from software and hardware trouble reports from production, shipboard installations and/or land based testing. Tech Refresh funding is provided to address obsolescence and reliability issues affecting fielded systems. The SEWIP Block 1B3 and Block 2 units are installed conjunctively to compose the AN/SLQ-32(V)6 system.  The SEWIP Block 1B3, Block 2 and Block 3 units are installed conjunctively to compose the AN/SLQ-32(V)7 system.  The SEWIP Block 1B3 P-3a funding has been broken out to separately show systems installed with SEWIP Block 2 (FMP Block 1B3 for SLQ-32 (V)6 ) and systems installed with SEWIP Block 2 and Block 3 (FMP Block 1B3 for SLQ-32 (V)7). For FMP Block 1B3 systems for SLQ-32 (V)6 and (V)7, production lead time for Block 1B3 is 15 months and these systems are then delivered to the system integrator, NSWC Crane, 6 months (A-180 days) prior to the start of the installation availability for integration into a SLQ-32 (V)6 or (V)7 system. 135 days is required for integration and testing with SEWIP Blocks 1B2 and 1B3 for SLQ-32 (V)6 and SEWIP Blocks 1B2, 1B3 and 3 for SLQ-32(V7), 15 days for preparation for shipment and delivery to the shipyard 30 days prior to the start of the availability (A-30).

Notes:

(1) Production Support provides for Government oversight of production, Government and Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) support of production related software and hardware problems, and engineering as well as integrated logistics support efforts in support of production and fielding. 

(2) Engineering Change Proposal (ECP) funding is to address reliability, obsolescence, and other issues associated with production.

(3) Installation cost estimates are based on actual costs of installations to date. 

(4) For FMP Block 1B3 systems, the production lead time is 21 months, 15 months for production and 6 months for systems integration prior to deliver to ship for installation.  The systems integrator, NSWC Crane, conducts integrations, testing, and preparation for shipment.  The 6 month integration period is composed of 135 days for integration and testing of the SEWIP Blocks 1B2, 1B2, and 2 into an SLQ-32(V)6 system, preparation for shipment (15 days) and delivery to the shipyard 30 days prior to the start of the availability (A-30).

(5) Due to reduction of SEWIP Block 3 hardware funding in FY20, the FY20 procurement for FMP Block 1B3 for AN/SLQ-32(V)6 increased from 18 to 19 at the FY 2021 President's Budget request.  Subsequently, the FY20 procurement for FMP Block 1B3 for AN/SLQ-32(V)7 decreased from 1 to 0.  The installation of SEWIP Block 1B3 as a AN/SLQ-32(V)6 system will proceed as planned.  This FY20 unit is being procured for LHD 5 for an FY23 installation.

Description.val:
TC059 - BLOCK 2 ELECTRONIC SUPPORT (ES) SYSTEM
Block 2 will provide AN/SLQ-32(V) an upgraded antenna, receiver, and combat systems interface. The upgrades will pace the threat, improve detection and accuracy and mitigate Electromagnetic Interference (EMI). The Block 2 hardware cost includes the SEWIP Block 2 ES system, Blanker-Video Mixer Group (AN/SLA-10D), Common Processing System, Common Display System, Liquid Conditioning Unit and Data Adaptation Processor.  The SEWIP Block 1B3 and Block 2 units are installed conjunctively and compose the AN/SLQ-32(V)6 system. The SEWIP Block 1B3, Block 2 and Block 3 units are installed conjunctively to compose the AN/SLQ-32(V)7 system. The SEWIP Block 2 P-3a funding has been broken out to separately show systems installed with SEWIP Block 1B3 (FMP Block 2 for SLQ-32 (V)6 ) and systems installed with SEWIP Block 1B3 and Block 3 (FMP Block 2 for SLQ-32 (V)7). For FMP Block 2 systems for SLQ-32 (V)6 and (V)7, the production lead time is 17 months and these systems are then delivered to the system integrator, NSWC Crane, 6 months (A-180 days) prior to the start of the installation availability for integration into a SLQ-32 (V)6 or (V)7 system. 135 days is required for integration and testing with SEWIP Blocks 1B2 and 1B3 for SLQ-32 (V)6 and SEWIP Blocks 1B2, 1B3 and 3 for SLQ-32(V7), 15 days for preparation for shipment and delivery to the shipyard 30 days prior to the start of the availability (A-30).

Notes:

(1) Production Support provides for Government production oversight and original equipment manufacturer (OEM) support of production.  This includes software, hardware problems, and integrated logistics support for production and fielding. 

(2) Tech Refresh funding in FY21-FY25 will provide for the continued procurement and retrofit of the SEWIP Block 2 system.  FY21 Tech Refresh funding increased from the FY 2020 President's Budget request to address upgraded Liquid Cooling Unit (LCU), implement enhanced cybersecurity safeguards and upgrade to the Next Generation Versa Module Europa (VME) system replacement. Tech Refresh of the LCU will address reliability and support cost drivers of the current configuration. Enhanced cybersecurity safeguards are required for the AN/SLQ-32(V)6 system to continue to be part of the integrated combat system. The Next Generation VME system replacement will update SEWIP Block 2 to VPX (also known as VME International Trade Association (VITA) standard 46) to correct VME bus bandwidth limitations, which will address obsolescence and reliability issues affecting fielded systems. 

(3) Engineering Change Proposal (ECP) funding increases from FY20 to FY21 in the FY 2021 President's Budget request to address essential mission critical safety, reliability, production and performance issues associated with production and is estimated based on current list of approved Class I ECPs.  There are currently 59 Class I ECPs approved for implementation. The FY21 amount will fund 13 of the highest priority ECPs, including correction of shock and vibration deficiencies, shelter improvements and modifications, single mode fiber conversions, Liquid Cooling Unit (LCU) production changes, data extraction enhancements and software integration.    

(4) For FMP Block 2 systems, the production lead time is 23 months, 17 months for production and 6 months for systems integration prior to delivery to a ship for installation.  The system integrator, NSWC Crane, conducts intefration, testing, and preparation for shipment.  The 6 month integration period is composed of 135 days for integration and testing of the SEWIP Blocks 1B2, 1B3 and 2 into an SLQ-32(V)6 system, preparation for shipment (15 days) and delivery to the shipyard 30 days prior to the start of the availability (A-30).  

(5) Due to reduction of SEWIP Block 3 hardware funding in FY20, the FY20 procurement for FMP Block 2 for AN/SLQ-32(V)6 increased from 18 to 19 at the FY 2021 President's Budget request.  Subsequently, the FY20 procurement for FMP Block 1B3 for AN/SLQ-32(V)7 decreased from 1 to 0.  The installation of SEWIP Block 2 as a AN/SLQ-32(V)6 system will proceed as planned.  This FY20 unit is being procured for LHD 5 for an FY23 installation.

Model.val: TC060 SURFACE EW IMPROVEMENTS BLOCK 3 ELECTRONIC ATTACK (EA) SYSTEM

Description.val:
Block 3 will provide an Electronic Attack (EA) capability improvement required for the AN/SLQ-32(V) system to keep pace with the threat. SEWIP Block 3 will provide a common EA capability to surface combatants (CVN, DDG, LHD) outfitted with the active variant of the AN/SLQ-32, mainly the (V)3 and (V)4, as well as select new-construction platforms. The program builds on the EW Electronic Support (ES) capability delivered by Blocks 1 and 2.  Development Status/Major Milestones are: Long Lead Material (LLM) was procured Q4 FY17, Milestone C Low Rate Initial Production (LRIP) Q1 FY19, IOT&E Q4 FY22, FRP is Q3 FY23. The SEWIP Block 1B3, Block 2 and Block 3 units compose the AN/SLQ-32(V)7 system.  This may be accomplished as a conjunctive installation with all SEWIP components installed at the same time or as a non-conjunctive installation by installing the SEWIP Block 3 on a ship with SEWIP Block 1B3 and Block 2 previously installed.

Notes: 

(1) Production Support provides for Government oversight of production, Government and original equipment manufacturer (OEM) support of production related software and hardware problems, and engineering as well as integrated logistics support efforts in support of production and fielding. 

(2) INCO spares requirements are based on the updated Program Support Data sheets and SEWIP Block 3 hardware reliability projections.

(3) SEWIP Block 3 Engineering Change Proposal (ECP) funding amounts are estimated based on the current maturity of the design and the anticipated changes during production to address known reliability and other issues.  

(4) LHD/CVN Electronic Attack (EA) Subsystem Design Change funding of $17.308M supports the Non-Recurring Engineering (NRE) for required hardware/software configuration modifications,  associated documentation, and SSDS combat system integration constraints necessary for installation onboard CVN/LHD class ships.  The NRE estimates are based on SEWIP Block 3 design and Navy engineering change actuals and will be completed on a fixed price contract CLIN.  The CLIN must be fully funding at the time of award in accordance with the Full Funding Policy (FAR 232.702).  The Quadrant configuration required for CVNs and LHDs is due to ship integration constraints including weight, center of gravity, field of view and mitigation of Electromagnetic Interferences.  The CVN/LHD configuration will be installed in four sponsons vice the two sponsons on DDGs.  This requires design changes to some of the current hardware configuration items including the cooling equipment. 

(5) SEWIP Block 3 installation costs include the procurement of four (4) quad plates per shipset to mount the SEWIP Block 3 antennas.  The quad plates are required two (2) years ahead of shipboard installation to support integration at NSWC Crane. 

(6) The current SEWIP Block 3 development contract was awarded in FY15 and includes fixed price production options for FY17 and FY18 which were bid in a competitive environment prior to the start of system development.  The program procured the FY17 and FY18 units at these contract prices. A new competitive contract will be awarded for FY19-FY23 production requirements. The estimated FY19-FY23 Block 3 unit prices are based on Engineering Development Model (EDM) actual cost data including an updated Bill of Material (BOM) and EDM purchase orders which reflect material cost growth and system complexities, including hardware ruggedization realized during development. Additionally, the FY20-24 unit prices include ancillary equipment required for installation.  

(7)  For FMP Block 3 systems, the production lead time is 30 months, 24 months for the production and 6 months for systems integration prior to delivery to ship for installation.  The anticipated delivery rate is one SEWIP Block 3 system every 2 months.  The systems integrator, NSWC Crane, conducts integration, testing, and preparation for shipment.  The 6 month integration period is composed of 135 days for integration and testing of the SEWIP Blocks 1B2, 1B3 and 2 into and SLQ-32(V)6 system, preparation for shipment (15 days) and delivery to the shipyard 30 days prior to the start of the availability (A-30).  

(8)  For additional clarity, the FY 2021 President's Budget request budget removed the procurement cost for the HES-C chillers from the Block 3 installation cost, and placed this cost in the Block 3 procurement cost.  The procurement of the High Efficiency, Super Capacity (HES-C) chillers required to increase shipboard cooling for Block 3 operation was realigned in the budget exhibit from the installation line in the FY 2020 President's Budget request, to the recurring hardware section.  The HES-C chiller unit upgrades procurements are required in the same year as the associated SEWIP Block 3 system.  Funding for Design Services Allocation (DSA) is required beginning two years before the installation of the chiller, and the year of installation for each planned chiller upgrade.  HES-C chiller unit upgrades are required for all LHD ships and certain DDG and CVN ships (10 of the 49 SEWIP Block 3 FMP systems.) LHD/CVN HES-C procurements are based on estimates from NSWC Philadelphia, the ISEA for the chiller.  

(9) The SEWIP Block 3 installation is significantly more complex than the SEWIP Block 2 installation. The SEWIP Block 3 installation includes the fabrication and outfitting of steel sponson structures to house the arrays, electronic processing racks, and cooling equipment hardware. The installation also includes the cost for internal space reconfiguration to fit the four-bay prime power equipment.
